SENT.plain: A 23-year-old man with Marfan's syndrome was admitted for repair of annulo-aortic ectasia and severe pectus excavatum
A submammary skin incision approach followed by bilateral subperichondrial resection of abnormal costal cartilages was performed
The left intercostal muscles and perichondrial sheaths were divided 2 inches lateral to the sternum in a parasternal fashion to place the retractor
The aortic root was replaced with a 23-mm St
Chest wall reconstruction was completed with a high sternal osteotomy and support of the sternum was made with Gortex strips (W.L
The patient made an uneventful recovery
